newsitem.title: CHINA: China region cotton output to hit 1.0 mln T in '96.
newsitem.headline: China region cotton output to hit 1.0 mln T in '96.

text.p: Cotton output in China's main cotton growing region of northwestern Xinjiang is seen hitting more than 1.0 million tonnes in 1996, the People's Daily said on Thursday.
The area of land under cotton in the northwestern region had increased by more than 54,000 hectares (133,000 acres) to 795,000 hectares (1.96 million acres), the newspaper said.
Earlier official estimates had forecast Xinjiang's cotton output at 1.02 million tonnes this year, up from 925,000 tonnes in 1995.
National cotton output in 1995 was about 4.4 million tonnes, official figures show.
